subject: Transfers & Postings in NHAI
text: Hay 7zlq <TTHTi nfearut 3414 / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 M1 (Tsm WRda7 &r_rTTif ATa+) #47 / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 HT National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) v-5 & 6, Vazr-10, ERG, #$ fcrt-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 NHAIPolicy Guidelines/Personnel Matters Policy Circular No 1.3.2.30 Dated December 2020 (As per approval given by Chairman on note dated 27.11.2020) Sub: Transfers & Postings in NHAI: NHAI is a project based organization, where continuity during the project cycle plays a pivotal role in timely completion and achievement of targets However , there may be some compelling reasons that necessitate transfer/ posting of officers, but each such transfer also leads to certain disruption in the work: Therefore, a balance needs to be maintained between project execution and manpower planning, by better transition strategy to minimise the disruption after transfers. 2 Therefore, to streamline the process and in supersession of all earlier orders, the transfers & postings proposals in NHAI will be decided as under: 'j) The proposals of Regional Officer, Project Director, Chief General Manager & General Manager shall be decided by the following Committee: (a) Chairman, NHAI In Chair (b) Member(Admn) Member (c) Member concerned Member (as per jurisdiction including Finance & Administration) (d) CGM(HR) Secretary (Non-Member) (ii) The proposals of Dy. Manager & above upto DGM (except Project Director) shall be decided by the following Committee: (a) Member(Admn) In Chair (b) Member concerned Member (as per jurisdiction including Finance & Administration) (c) CGM(HR) Secretary (Non-Member) 3. The following may be noted: Chairman will continue to enjoy the inherent powers to transfer any officer The committees may decide the approach/ criteria to be followed while taking decisions on such proposals, as deemed fit, keeping in mind the extant instructions and the objective of minimum disruption. (iii) The minutes containing the decisions of above committees and consequent orders shall be issued on the same (iv) All Divisions and Regional Officers shall give their requirements of Officers to Administration Division for use during the above process_ (v) outside influence shall be dealt with as per OM dated 27.08.2012 of NHAI and adverse entry shall be made in their APAR. 4 This comes into immediate effect.
